inclusion.criterion: VAO atherosclerotic stenosis results in posterior circulation ischemic symptom
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: symptomatic VAO atherosclerotic stenosis>70% evaluated by computed tomograph
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: angiography(CTA) or Magnetic Resonance Angiography(MRA) or digital subtraction angiography(DSA)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the diameter of the normal segment of the artery beyond the stenosis >3.5mm
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: VAO stenosis is combined with ipsilateral vertebrobasilar disease including severe cranial vertebral artery stenosis and severe basilar artery stenosis.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patients who will be underwent bilateral VAOS due to bilateral VAO stenosis including someone with bilateral VAO stenosis >70% and the patient who need contralateral VAOS after stenting in unilateral VAO due to recurrent posterior circulation ischemia refractory to best medical treatment.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: VAO stenosis caused by arteritis,artery dissection, aplasia, vasculopathy caused by radiotherapy etc, other than atherosclerosis;
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: stroke within 30 days or myocardial infarction within 6 months;
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: contraindication of anticoagulant and antiplatelet agents; allergy to iodinated contrast agent;
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: severe comorbid diseases and intolerant to procedure; patient unlikely to cooperate with the procedure or provide informed consent.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: High risk of difficulty or failure in EPD advance and retrieval due to the tortuosity of the culprit vertebral artery origin.
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has a history of CAD s/p CABG, EF 60% prior CVA (no residual deficits), HTN, HL, DMII, Moderate to Severe PVD. He reports occasional dizziness and denies CP/SOB. Carotid U/S showed significant bilateral carotid stenosis, L>R. Angiography revealed an 80% stenosis of the R ICA and a 90% L ICA stenosis.
